result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taurus D Singleton-Marchant

records.addlTxt: 11:32 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Taurus D Singleton-Marchant in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Taurus D Singleton-Marchant.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed in the document.  Defense and State confirm the offer.  Pursuant to the offer the Court orders this case be dismissed and read into 21CF580.

Hearing on November 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Comply with all the conditions set in Waukesha County case 21CF580.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

1:41 PM; Case called for Initial appearance.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taurus D Singleton-Marchant in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Taurus D Singleton-Marchant. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Atty. Miller also notes she is prepared to proceed with the waiver of preliminary hearing in this matter today.  Court has colloqy with the defendant.  Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily waiving the preliminary hearing.  Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Miller asks that this matter tag along with 21CF580 for status.  Court adjourns for status.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

01:18 PM Defendant Taurus D Singleton-Marchant in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court was notified this matter was in warrant status after the defendant appeared on 22CF580.  The Court will quash the warrant and set this matter for an initial appearance before the Trial Court for the same date as the plea and sentencing.  Parties anticipate this matter would be a waiver and could potentially be resolved at the next date as well.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
